title: lots of ldap errors, but everything seems to work
body:
this issue was previously described in the forum: http://forum.owncloud.org/viewtopic.php?f=23&t=10983

in my owncloud installation, i get many ldap errors, but everything seems to work. however, the ldap errors fill the logfile and make it annoying to read.

since april 22 (~5 weeks), the logfile has grown to over 7000 lines, all ldap errors.

i tested a few actions while looking if the logfile grows, but no log entry could be related to a specific action.

the logfile looks like this: (notice there are only two different timestamps in this extract, so the entries are probably from only two actions)
http://pastebin.com/sgyjvc3b

my setup is owncloud 5.0.6 on an apache 2.2/php 5.3.3 using a postgresql 8.4 on a debian 6 (squeeze) server serving 5-10 users. the users use the desktop client for windows and linux to access their files, map it as a network drive (windows), use the webinterface (firefox, chrome) and the mobile apps (android & ios).

the ldap is provided by another linux server running openldap. as a member-group-assoc, i use the ad-way via member attribute. all other settings are quite standard.

some other user in the forum has the same problem. ( -> paullindsey)
